result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Hiawatha Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Hiawatha Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 1 (one) day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

  
Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by December 7, 2016 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed. 

Court ordered restitution set at $117.64 payable to Walmart by December 7, 2016 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.

-20 day appeal given,
 
Filed;
-Restitution Worksheet;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Larry Hiawatha Johnson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Larry Hiawatha Johnson in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR NEXT SCHEDULED HEARING.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Larry Hiawatha Johnson not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Larry Hiawatha Johnson not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense waived defendant's appearance. Request for Substitution of Judge previously received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37. Defense requests a Status Conference. Case adjourned to branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant has a pending case 15CM2983 and a request for substitution of Judge was filed with the Court for this pending and reassigned to Branch 37. 
Status Conference was set for this 15CM2983 on 9/2/2015 at 8:30am before Branch 37.
Received and Filed, Request for Substitution of Judge.
Bond continued as previously set. Signature Bond paperwork is not in the file.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any Walmart Stores.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Larry Hiawatha Johnson in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-29-2015 at 1:30pm
